intro: Paraboea multiflora var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "villosa." The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Rubiaceae family.
